citations.narrative:
Two fennec foxes were acquired by the facility in early 2023 and the foxes were on exhibit at the time of the inspection.
The existing 3 year USDA license that was issued to the licensee at the end of June 2022 does not have the special
category of animals “hyenas and/or exotic and wild canids (including but not limited to wolves, coyotes, foxes, and
jackals)” authorized on the license. The licensee removed the fennec foxes from public display.
Per this Section, licenses authorize the use of animals subject to subparts A through F except that for subpart D and F
animals, a license must specifically authorize the use of 6 specific groups of animals, one of which is “hyenas and/or
exotic and wild canids (including but not limited to wolves, coyotes, foxes, and jackals)”. A licensee must obtain a new
license before using any animal beyond those types authorized under the existing license. The licensee needs to keep the
fennec foxes off exhibit and needs to apply for a new license that includes authorization for the group "hyenas and/or
exotic and wild canids". Correct by 9/30/23.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representatives.
*END OF REPORT*
